Found in compliance.
IV. TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE
The facility was offered technical assistance in the following areas:
 R 400.4142 Health services; policies and procedures.
(1) An institution shall establish and follow written health service policies and
procedures addressing all of the following:
(a) Routine and emergency medical, dental, and behavioral health care.
A youth was recommended for a vision screen at his 12/22/2020 physical
examination. This appointment was delayed and rescheduled due to COVID
19 and youth refusal. Youth A’s vision exam is rescheduled for 05/18/2021.
Allowances given due to COVID is fluid and dependent on executive orders
and current health department guidelines. An allowance was given in this case.
V. CONSULTATION
The facility was offered consultation in the following areas:
 A reminder per FOM 912-1 effective 04/01/2021 Updated treatment plans are
due every 60 days from the last treatment plan instead of 90 days from the last
treatment plan.
1

VI. EVALUATION OF RENEWAL PERIOD
There were no substantiated incidents of maltreatment in care during this licensing
period.
Optimist House submitted two acceptable corrective action plans not related to
maltreatment during this licensing period.
 2021C0217006 R 400.4126 Sufficiency of staff was cited. Written discipline
was issued to the staff person involved in horseplaying with a youth. This
incident appears to be an isolated incident between the staff person and youth.
 2021C0221010 R 400.4109 Program statement was cited. Staff reviewed
COVID – 19 personal protection equipment guidelines and procedures on
03/07/2021. Staff wore masks during unannounced visits in 03/2021 and
05/2021. COVID – 19 personal protection equipment compliance continues to
be monitored and addressed as needed.
VII. RECOMMENDATION
Based on inspection findings the facility is in compliance with all applicable licensing
statutes and rules and/or ISEP requirements and/or contract and policy. It is
recommended that the facility continue on their regular license.
